attributes.review: I downloaded this app to tune into politics. When I opened the app a orange man appeared. Suddenly I was overloaded with this horrible feeling. Almost a game over for me. It started with my eyes turning orange, then I started to sweat peppermint extract, my legs exploded with confetti, my hair started to turn into cheese, and worst of all my skin turned into paper towel. That only happened to me. My sister who was sitting next to me fell over and pooped herself (yikes!). Then my house started to fill up with vanilla sprite!! I took me and my sister out and when I was going to call ur mom my phone dissolved into sand. Right now I am writing this in my head and sending my brainwaves to my step uncle, who was twice removed. Hopefully he can upload my tragedies

attributes.review:
one day this app literally popped up on my phone with no explanation. i opened it and immediately after all of my 69 fish passed away. shortly after my very own hammerhead shark banged his head into the glass until he died after seeing how ugly the app is. my 420 pet beetles also mysteriously passed away. this trend continued with my frogs, wooly mammoths, anteaters, and dodo birds. in hopes of being able to delete the app i found a remedy for my phone on the black web. following the instructions exactly i lit 10 candles, turned all of the lights off in my bathroom, and said â€œuh-oh stinkyâ€ three times with my eyes closed, turning around each time. suddenly a stinky orange man showed up in my bathroom drenched in idiot juice and started telling me all of this random stuff. when i gave him
a mike tyson uppercut from hell he fell back and died! the app was deleted and my animals were all revived from the dead. iâ€™m afraid if i had the app had stayed on my phone longer i wouldâ€™ve died! overall, the app is deadly and and only for morons. safe downloading everyone ğŸ˜ƒ

attributes.review:
i downloaded this app hoping to see something about politics, but instead it completely glitched out and started saying â€œ The FitnessGram PACER Test is a multistage aerobic capacity test that progressively gets more difficult as it continues.
The test is used to measure a student's aerobic capacity as part of the FitnessGram assessment. Students run back and forth as many times as they can, each lap signaled by a beep sound. The test get progressively faster as it continues until the student reaches their max lap score.

The PACER Test score is combined in the FitnessGram software with scores for muscular strength, endurance, flexibility and body composition to determine whether a student is in the Healthy Fitness Zoneâ„¢ or the Needs Improvement Zoneâ„¢.
